A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It is in some ways nearly unfathomable that a movie this good--one that plays with its predecessors' rhythms so joyfully and so effectively--barely outscores bored Tarantino garbage like Django Unchained\, which does not. TLJ is not a perfect film and the postmodern irrelevant subplot will annoy traditionalists\, but the thrill of the new and the graceful exit of the old (my lord--it is good to see Yoda back on his game after the CGI horrors of the prequels) makes TLJ a lasting artistic contribution to the franchise.
